items.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18693)
items.content_html:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

items.title: "House lawmakers on Wednesday passed the George Floyd...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"House lawmakers on Wednesday passed the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act, a reform bill that would ban chokeholds and alter so-called qualified immunity for law enforcement, which would make it easier to pursue claims of police misconduct."

NPR

The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.

npr.org

House Approves Police Reform Bill Named After George Floyd

The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.The bill, which would ban chokeholds and eliminate qualified immunity for law enforcement, now advances to the Senate.

items.title: "President Joe Biden has come through with his promise to...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"President Joe Biden has come through with his promise to promote inclusion by appointing Reggie Greer as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues"

PinkNews

Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.

pinknews.co.uk

Joe Biden stays true to his word by appointing senior advisor on LGBT+ issues

Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.Former Victory Institute staffer Reggie Greer has officially joined president Joe Biden’s administration as a senior advisor on LGBT+ issues.

items.content_html:

Denver Westword

Celebrate local music at the MCA.

westword.com

MCA Denver Launches Garageband Concert Series

Celebrate local music at the MCA.Celebrate local music at the MCA.

items.title: Tune in to hear me and Joe Neguse talk about unity in these...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Tune in to hear me and Joe Neguse talk about unity in these challenging times— and why we need to stand together!

items.title: "Sitting here in my cell at the New Jersey State Prison,...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Sitting here in my cell at the New Jersey State Prison, where I’ve spent the last 15 years, it can be hard to find hope and humanity in a structure designed to take that away from you. I am the wooden boy in this prison, controlled by all sorts of strings."

The Marshall Project

How I Keep Hope Alive While Serving 150 Years in Prison

themarshallproject.org

How I Keep Hope Alive While Serving 150 Years in Prison

How I Keep Hope Alive While Serving 150 Years in PrisonHow I Keep Hope Alive While Serving 150 Years in Prison

items.title: "When the Colorado Legislature set its budget for public...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"When the Colorado Legislature set its budget for public schools in May 2020, lawmakers had little idea what a profound impact COVID-19 would have on the education system and families with school-age children. This year’s session is tasked with settling up — not just financially but also in the classroom."

The Denver Post

A measure that largely keeps state money steady for 2020-21 school year headed to Gov. Polis; other issues include standardized testing and paying school board members

denverpost.com

Colorado schools won’t lose funding this school year — and 3 other education bills to watch

A measure that largely keeps state money steady for 2020-21 school year headed to Gov. Polis; other issues include standardized testing and paying school board membersA measure that largely keeps state money steady for 2020-21 school year headed to Gov. Polis; other issues include standardized testing and paying school board members

items.title: "'It was the absolute perfect time,' Reis...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"'It was the absolute perfect time,' Reis explained, as Polis asked to marry him. 'I said to him: ‘I couldn’t breathe before. Now I really can’t breathe’.'
Thankfully, he caught his breath and said yes."

PinkNews

Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.

pinknews.co.uk

US governor proposed to boyfriend as he was being rushed to hospital with COVID

Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.

"House Democrats passed sweeping voting and ethics legislation Wednesday over unanimous Republican opposition, advancing to the Senate what would be the largest overhaul of the U.S. election law in at least a generation."

The Denver Post

items.title: "The economic crisis precipitated by the pandemic has only...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The economic crisis precipitated by the pandemic has only fueled an existing eviction catastrophe. Today, nearly 18 million households have little or no confidence in their ability to pay the rent, [...] and landlords have filed hundreds of thousands of evictions during the pandemic despite the federal eviction moratorium."

The Appeal

Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.

theappeal.org

The American Eviction Crisis, Explained

Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.

items.title: "U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of Colorado renters — some 181,000 households — have slight or no confidence they can make rent without aid. But the rental housing industry argues that stories like Nichols’ are evidence that the state is doing OK when it comes to managing the housing insecurity crisis."

The Denver Post

Like roughly nine in 10 Coloradans, Whitney Nichols makes the rent every month. U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of Colorado renters — some 181,000 households — have s…

denverpost.com

Coalition of Colorado Democrats wants to strip power from landlords and hand it to tenants instead

Like roughly nine in 10 Coloradans, Whitney Nichols makes the rent every month. items.title: "Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing."

The Colorado Sun

Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing. Laura Charlton, 51, watched her self-made massage therapy busines...

coloradosun.com

Coronavirus crushed Colorado’s economy. But working women paid the highest price.

Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing. items.title: "The spike has made public safety a central issue in an...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The spike has made public safety a central issue in an upcoming mayoral election. But in a city that’s been reckoning with racial justice since the police murder of Michael Brown in nearby Ferguson seven years ago, many are saying that ramping up policing isn’t the answer."

The Appeal

Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.

theappeal.org

Policing and Public Safety at Odds in St. Louis Mayoral Race

Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.

items.title: "Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette Johnson’s fiery dissents on mass incarceration and sentencing in America’s most carceral state garnered international attention. But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep South’s white power structure."

The Appeal

Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette Johnson’s fiery dissents on mass incarceration and sentencing in America’s most carceral state garnered international attention. But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep So...

items.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280
